Welcome to Mini #1471: Rural Mafia


Way out in the middle of nowhere is a teeny tiny town with a teeny tiny population. The only help the Townspeople have out there is themselves, their pitchforks, and some strong hangin' ropes. Now, they haven't used them hangin' ropes for over sixty years, but they're about to need them again - the Mafia has infiltrated the Town! Several of the Townspeople are traitors(!) working to kill the rest so that the teeny tiny town can be used as a trade stop in the drug trade. Does the stress drive anyone crazy? Is yoga devil worship? Will the Mafia control the town? Where the hell is this place, anyway?

Find out in: Rural Mafia!

Rules (stolen from literally everyone who has ever modded a game on this site at some point):
1. All sitewide rules/guidelines apply.
2. I'm using this colour, try not to use it or I'll assume you're impersonating me.
3. Communication about this game is not allowed outside of this thread, excepting in Mod-supplied locations.
4. Don't quote things about this game that come from outside of the thread. You may paraphrase. Use good judgement.
5. Breadcrumbing and other forms of in-thread communication are fine. Don't do anything weird and encrypted though.
6. Prods will be issued after 72 hours, or 48 on request (requested prods for a time period less than 72 hours will not be counted as "official" prods). If you don't post for 24 hours after a prod, you will be replaced.
7. Players with three "official" prods will be replaced.
8. Players on V/LA will not be prodded until 48 hours after their V/LA ends.
9. Days 1 and 2 will be three weeks long. Subsequent days will last two weeks. Nights 1 and 2 will be three days in duration. Subsequent nights will last two days. The scum may elect to shorten the night by 24 hours, provided all night actions have been submitted. Daystart PMs will be provided.
10. Votes must be bolded/votetagged.
11. Lynches require simple majority (50% + 1). No lynch will occur if this is not reached by deadline. You may also vote no-lynch. No-lynch will also require simple majority.
12. Once a lynch has been reached, all living players and the lynched player may continue talking until the flip is posted.
13. If actions are not submitted by deadline they are forfeit.
14. Flavour is not relevant. At all. It's the same tinytown stuff that has been run in the Normal sections forever.
15. Rules will be modified if necessary. Players will be notified if this occurs.

Spoiler: Sample Vanilla PM
You are a Vanilla Townie.
You just want life to go back to normal. After all, you wouldn't be living it if you didn't like it, right?
Each Day you may pitchfork vote for who you think is Mafia.
Each Night you may sleep.
You win when no threats to the (teeny tiny) Town remain.
Roles have been randomized and PMs are being sent. Day 1 will begin when 10/13 have confirmed.
10/13 have confirmed. The remainder have 48 hours from the time of this post to do so or be replaced.

Attacking a player for doing something deemed completely acceptable is scummy.

It's not a false dichotomy because those ARE the only possible options they can be. A good town player would not attack another player for doing something that is generally considered an acceptable act.

Next point I want to address:
This notion/concept/whatever on this board that "If you are town, you will answer all questions right away, immediately." I have found this to be false and/or a bad strategy to grasp onto so tightly. As a general rule of thumb, yes... share info with everybody. But I pointed to a couple general scenarios to support my position, and I'll try to elaborate a bit with a specific example from this game (for anybody who cares.) "Spoilered" so it doesn't clutter up the page:

Spoiler:
Earlier in game, I asked Gen-Wolf for his read on a player.
Mr E Roll questioned me as to why I asked specifically for Gen-Wolf's opinion.
I asked for latitude in answering it... Not because I didn't want to answer the question, but because the TIMING of it was poor from my perspective. Why poor timing?

At said time, I had a strong town read on Gen-Wolf that I didn't want to reveal as the reason for choosing him for an opinion. Often times, I ask my town reads for their opinions on people that I'm suspicious of. It helps develop content for the thread, as well as association patterns for later analysis, it gives me another opinion (that I value) to cross check my opinion against, and it can instigate comfortable conversation. You'll notice I did the same thing with Robb, asking him about RedCoyote So a very simple "softball question" can effectively do 2-4 things at once and not tip my hand. I like to play with my cards close to my chest and very often will obscure or hide my motivations/goals in the short term. I'm always happy to reveal them later and explain thoroughly, once the play has been made or the opportunity expired.

Why didn't I want to reveal my town read on Gen-Wolf? I don't think that D1 midday it's a good strategy for every townie to be revealing who their strongest town reads are as it only helps mafia. They know who is town, but they need to choose between trying to kill PR's or killing the more "townie" players, or hoping they are one in the same. Sharing certain things are great for the town, sharing everything isn't...

The mafia has an information advantage, inherent to the game, but strategic town play can limit the additional information they glean from day phases. There's situation variations on this, IE, player is facing a lynch (share all your thoughts before you go), you're a overwhelmingly "town" read player (you might get popped overnight), etc. But for my current situation in this game and time, I thought it a bad play. I'm town, but I'm drawing suspicion and heat. I can guess that the mafia will likely leave me alone overnight as a potential mislynch (since public sentiment is going that way.) My analysis says that chances are I can save the reveal of my town reads and sweeping opinions until a later point in the game, when it is more beneficial to town (it may be later this day phase if everybody decides to lynch me instead of Robb, for this crazy wall o text.)

More reasons: At said time, I hadn't spent much time focusing on Mr E Roll, but I knew he had done some digging into Gen-Wolf. I hadn't formulated a read. If my read on Mr E Roll says "maybe scum", and my read on Gen-Wolf says "maybe town", I may adjust how I answer the question of why I chose Gen-Wolf specifically. I don't like giving mafia the info they are "LOOKING FOR"... so maybe I do an evil thing that everybody on this board says townies should never do and "LIE" when I respond to Mr E Roll about why I specifically asked Gen-Wolf. Maybe instead of saying "I think he's town, and I wanted his opinion" which is the truth, I say "Gen-Wolf hadn't engaged anybody on my short list, and I thought it helpful to develop content" which is a BLATANT LIE about my motivation/reasoning, but true enough that nobody would care.

P.S. Not only do I think it's okay for townies to not answer questions some times, I also thinks it's okay for them to tell certain lies (see above.) Nobody tell Robb I said that.

In reality, sometimes it's like writing a novel to explain why I choose to do/don't do something sometimes. I don't always have the time to type up a book of Bauss's strange take on mafia strategies. It was easier to just say "Latitude please" or "Can I circle back around to this later?" I know it's different, and if I have to conform to the standards here in order to be a long term player/contributor, I'll take that into consideration. In the interim, I'm okay with having scum points as I'm not a player that craves being confirmed town. As a player, I LIKE to play in the gray zone that keeps me fighting.

It was quite a day. So many townspeople were moving out and moving in that it started to become hard to tell the normal, innocent family men from the terrors of the night, the sane from the insane, the good from the bad, or the truth from the lies - but that didn't stop anyone from trying. People began to battle with bouts of paranoia, and a Cold War-era program was quickly set up. Neighbours turned on neighbours, family upon family, as reporting someone else might just make you safer for once.
Eventually this became too much, and all the citizens of the teeny tiny tiny town, good and bad alike, began to set traps for one another...

And so it was that one of them tripped, fell, and shot himself in the foot with his own gun.
As several citizens had shot themselves in the past, no-one thought much of it. But when they began to move him, intending first aid, they discovered 6 kilos of cocaine strapped to his body.
So they lynched him instead, and rid themselves of a killer and the expense of bandages in one fell swoop.

Um

What is kingmaker? I thought that was role
Kingmaker is when one side is put in the position of picking the winner without actually having the ability to win itself.

Kingmaker means like:

Suppose there are three players:
1 town
1 mafia
1 SK

the town player cannot win by lynching either non-town
If he lynches either, the other NKs him and town loses
His only hope is to no lynch and hope that the mafiate and SK kill one another that night
Otherwise he is playing Kingmaker: he decides which scum faction gets the win

With four:
2 town
1 Mafia
1 SK

the two townies are still in kingmaker: lynching SK or mafia results in one of the townies getting NKed that night, and scum wins at 1:1
Therefore, whichever faction they DON'T lynch wins, thus the two townies are the kingmakers

For this reason, I don't like RC's vote on Empking

HOWEVER

if there is

3 town
1 SK

Then we aren't in kingmaker. We're in MyLo instead. We lynch right, it's gg nextmap. We lynch wrong, and go into night with three, were fucked.
